seg.output:
Greetings and peace of conscience through Christ.
No doubt you remember what I recently discussed with you and Leon about allowing us to join forces. We have also presented the same to our prefect. We had an easy time with him and he even promised to offer us his help to make it more gratifying. However, in order for nothing to be done rashly, he has decided that the senate of Zurich should first be warned by letter, so that it can report this in writing or through its representatives at the Baden assembly, as conveniently as possible. Therefore, we ask that you send those letters to your consul and strongly recommend both us and the matter itself. We do not doubt that this will be done with the utmost diligence, given your faithfulness and kindness.
Farewell.
Given quickly in Frauenfeld on the Kalends of August in the year 1532.
Peter Dasypodius, on behalf of the brothers in the Durgean region.
To Henry Bullinger, a most faithful preacher of the Gospel at the Zurich church, from a brother.
